member.summary: To add an address to your address book, you create a new address object. You can retrieve and delete individual addresses as well as get a list of addresses. Addresses are identified by a unique random ID.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.AddressBook_ListAddress(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: To add an address to your address book, you create a new address object. You can retrieve and delete individual addresses as well as get a list of addresses. Addresses are identified by a unique random ID. Returns a list of your addresses. The addresses are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created addresses appearing first.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.AddressBook_ListAddress
member.summary: To add an address to your address book, you create a new address object. You can retrieve and delete individual addresses as well as get a list of addresses. Addresses are identified by a unique random ID. Returns a list of your addresses. The addresses are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created addresses appearing first.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.AddressBook_DeleteAddresses(System.String)
member.summary: To add an address to your address book, you create a new address object. You can retrieve and delete individual addresses as well as get a list of addresses. Addresses are identified by a unique random ID. Permanently deletes a customer. It cannot be undone.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.PhoneNumbers_AvailablePhoneNumbers(System.String,System.String,Msg360API.AvaliablePhoneNumberType)
member.summary: The request response returned here contains a list of all available phone numbers that can be purchased for use with your Message360 account.
member.param: Two letter country code of the available phone number.
Code used to identify the phone numbers geographic origin. Found at the beginning of the number.
Specifies the desired characters contained within the available numbers to list.
Specifies the desired region of the available numbers to be listed.
Specifies the desired postal code of the available numbers to be listed.
Search for local (default) or toll free nubmers.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Calls_ViewCall(System.String)
member.summary: A call resource provides information about an individual call that has occurred through Message360. Both inbound and outbound voice communication through Message360 are categorized as calls. The resource properties representing a call are listed below. Call resources can be accessed at a resource URI made up of the Message360 base URL and a unique call SID.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Calls_ListCall
member.summary: The request response returned here contains a list of calls associated with your Message360 account.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Calls_ListCall(Msg360API.CallListOptions)
member.summary: The request response returned here contains a list of calls associated with your Message360 account.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Calls_MakeCall(Msg360API.CallOptions)

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Calls_InterruptCall(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{Msg360API.HttpMethod},System.Nullable{Msg360API.HangupCallStatus})
member.summary: Here you can experiment with modifying a call through Message360 and view the request response doing so generates.
member.param: An alphanumeric string used for identification of calls
The URL in-progress calls can be forwarded to.
Specifies the HTTP method used to request forwarding URL. Allowed Value: POST or GET. Default Value: POST
The status used to end the call. canceled only ends queued/ringing calls while completed ends in-progress calls as well as queued/ringing calls. Allowed Value: canceled or completed

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Calls_InterruptCall(System.String)
member.summary: Here you can experiment with modifying a call through Message360 and view the request response doing so generates.
member.param: An alphanumeric string used for identification of calls
The URL in-progress calls can be forwarded to.
Specifies the HTTP method used to request forwarding URL. Allowed Value: POST or GET. Default Value: POST
The status used to end the call. canceled only ends queued/ringing calls while completed ends in-progress calls as well as queued/ringing calls. Allowed Value: canceled or completed

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Calls_SendDigitsToCall(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Here you can experiment with sending digits to a call through MSG360API and view the request response generated when doing so.
member.param: An alphanumeric string used for identification of calls

Specifies which touch tone signals to send to a call. W or w can be used to include half second pauses within the digit transmission. For example: wwww1234 waits two seconds before sending the digits and 12wwww34 waits two seconds in between the sending of 12 and 34. Allowed Value: the digits 0-9, W, or w
Specifies which leg of the call digits will be sent to. 'aleg' leg is the originator of the call, 'bleg' is the recipient of the call.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Calls_SendDigitsToCall(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Here you can experiment with sending digits to a call through MSG360API and view the request response generated when doing so.
member.param: An alphanumeric string used for identification of calls

Specifies which touch tone signals to send to a call. W or w can be used to include half second pauses within the digit transmission. For example: wwww1234 waits two seconds before sending the digits and 12wwww34 waits two seconds in between the sending of 12 and 34. Allowed Value: the digits 0-9, W, or w
Specifies which leg of the call digits will be sent to. 'aleg' leg is the originator of the call, 'bleg' is the recipient of the call.

member.summary: Here you can experiment with initiating or terminating a live call recording through Message360 and view the request response generated when doing so.
member.param: An alphanumeric string used for identification of calls
Specifies if call recording should beging or end. To start recording a call, value must be true. To stop recording a call, value must be false.

member.summary: Here you can experiment with initiating or terminating a live call recording through Message360 and view the request response generated when doing so.
member.param: An alphanumeric string used for identification of calls
Specifies if call recording should beging or end. To start recording a call, value must be true. To stop recording a call, value must be false.
The time in seconds the duration a call recording should not exceed. If no value specified, recordings are 60 seconds by default.
URL where recording information will be relayed to after it has completed.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.PostCardServices_CreatePostCard(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The postcards endpoint allows you to easily print and mail postcards. The postcard front must be supplied as a PDF, image, or an HTML string. The back can be a PDF, image, HTML string, or it can be automatically generated by supplying a custom message. The API provides endpoints for creating postcards, retrieving individual postcards, and retrieving a list of postcards.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.PostCardServices_CreatePostCard(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Object,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The postcards endpoint allows you to easily print and mail postcards. The postcard front must be supplied as a PDF, image, or an HTML string. The back can be a PDF, image, HTML string, or it can be automatically generated by supplying a custom message. The API provides endpoints for creating postcards, retrieving individual postcards, and retrieving a list of postcards.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.PostCardServices_ViewPostcard(System.String)
member.summary: The postcards endpoint allows you to easily print and mail postcards. The postcard front must be supplied as a PDF, image, or an HTML string. The back can be a PDF, image, HTML string, or it can be automatically generated by supplying a custom message. The API provides endpoints for creating postcards, retrieving individual postcards, and retrieving a list of postcards. Retrieves the postcard with a given ID. You need only supply the unique postcard ID that was returned upon postcard creation.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.PostCardServices_ListPostcard(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Postcards allow you to send your a print job for an postcard that will be printed and mailed. Postcards have both a front and back and can either be generated via the API or using images. You can retrieve individual postcards as well as a list of all your postcards. Returns a list of postcards. The postcards are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created postcards appearing first.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.PostCardServices_ListPostcard
member.summary: Postcards allow you to send your a print job for an postcard that will be printed and mailed. Postcards have both a front and back and can either be generated via the API or using images. You can retrieve individual postcards as well as a list of all your postcards. Returns a list of postcards. The postcards are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created postcards appearing first.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.PostCardServices_DeletePostcard(System.String)
member.summary: Delete postcard permenantly.

member.name: M:Msg360API.Msg360APIRestClient.Transcription_TranscribeRecording(System.String)
member.summary: Here you can experiment with transcribing recordings that have occurred through your message360 account and view the request response generated when doing so.
member.param: An alphanumeric string used for identification of recording.

member.summary: Specifies the HTTP method used to request the Heartbeat URL.

member.name: P:Msg360API.CallOptions.Timeout
member.summary: Number of seconds call stays on the line while waiting for an answer. The max time limit is 999 and the default limit is 60 seconds but lower times can be set.
